items.title: Lions safety Branch suspended 1 game for fight
items.summary: The NFL has suspended Lions safety Brian Branch for one game without pay after he struck Chiefs wide receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster and set off a brief fight.

items.title: Colts work out four players—including veteran cornerback
items.summary: According to KPRC2’s Aaron Wilson, the Indianapolis Colts worked out four players on Monday including offensive tackle Bayron Matos, safety Israel Mukuamu, cornerback Levi Wallace, and offensive tackle Trey Wedig: The 30-year-old Levi Wallace is the most experienced player on this list, having made 72 career starts (appearing in 96 career games). He appeared in […]

items.title: Colts place injured QB on IR, while claiming safety from Ravens off waivers
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts announced on Monday that the team has placed injured backup quarterback Anthony Richardson Sr. (eye) on injured reserve, while claiming safety Reuben Lowery off waivers from the Baltimore Ravens in a corresponding 53-man roster move. Richardson Sr. reportedly fractured his orbital bone while doing band work during pre-game warm ups this past […]

items.summary: Patrick Mahomes, Baker Mayfield, Drake Maye or Rico Dowdle -- only one of them could win Week 6's "Himmy" Award.

items.summary: The stars are back in the pregame tunnels, arriving in looks that match their personal style.

items.summary: Richardson sustained a fractured orbital bone during pregame band work prior to the Colts' Week 6 game against the Arizona Cardinals.

items.title: Bill Brooks' Breakdown: How Colts overcame pregame adversity to beat Cardinals in Week 6
items.summary: Beginning this week, Colts Ring of Honor wide receiver Bill Brooks will offer his viewpoint of the Colts' most recent game, from major storylines to key plays. In this week's column, Bill looks at how the Colts handled two teammates sustaining injuries in pregame warm-ups, plus a massive play on defense in the first half.

items.title: Colts’ Monday Morning Awards: Week 5 vs. Cardinals
items.summary: 5-1. Good teams beat down bad teams, but another thing good teams manage to do is win when they are not at their best, and the Colts managed to do just that against the Cardinals. The game was not pretty, perhaps the worst game I have seen from the team this season, but they managed […]

items.title: Colts place Anthony Richardson Sr. on IR; exploring vet options at backup QB
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The clock is ticking on Riley Leonard’s status as the Indianapolis Colts’ backup quarterback. In football lexicon, he’s day-to-day. In the aftermath of Anthony Richardson Sr. suffering a fractured orbital bone in a freak accident prior to Sunday’s 31-27 win over the Arizona Cardinals, the Colts are exploring whether a veteran quarterback would [...]

items.title: Around the AFC South: Colts in sole possession of first place in division after Jaguars loss
items.summary: The Jaguars lost to the Seahawks and the Titans lost to the Raiders on Sunday; the Texans were on a bye in Week 6.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 432: Victory Monday as Colts Top Cardinals
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts didn't play their best but improved to 5-1 after topping the Arizona Cardinals at Lucas Oil Stadium. Matt Adams recaps the 31-27 win in the latest edition of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast. Find the Colts Blue Zone Podcast on YouTube, Apple Podcasts or Spotify.

items.title: Colts pass rush with season-best performance against Cardinals
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — The Indianapolis Colts’ pass rush through five weeks had been touted as a struggling unit that lacked consistency. This unit has been getting the job done, but a below-average pressure percentage (T-21st) and league-worst (T-31st) get-off rate has raised questions as to whether or not this group has enough juice to last […]

items.title: Indianapolis Colts stick to top of AFC playoff picture with win
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts won their Sunday game over the plucky Arizona Cardinals. With the win, the Colts stay atop the AFC and no matter what happens on Sunday and Monday, Indianapolis will enter Week 7 atop the conference. In the AFC South, the Jacksonville Jaguars fell on Sunday to the Seattle Seahawks, giving Indianapolis even […]

items.title: Colts-Chargers opening odds: Colts looking to unplug the Chargers
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts have another major opportunity to cement their legitimacy as they head out on the road for their second test of the season. Ironically enough, it will be in the exact same building in which they lost in crushing fashion to the Los Angeles Rams. The L.A. part stays the same, but Chargers […]

items.title: Colts get the win but show plenty of room for improvement on defense
items.summary: When the news flashed that Kyler Murray would be sidelined for the week six tilt against the Indianapolis Colts, there were quite a few people expecting an absolute beat down. Overcoming numerous injuries that included the starting quarterback seemed like too much for a team that had lost three straight on last second field goals. […]

items.title: Colts’ Riley Leonard: 1 play away instead of 2 plays away
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Just like that, Riley Leonard’s Sunday afternoon at the office changed. In the blink of an eye — or to be more precise, when Anthony Richardson Sr. suffered an eye injury during pre-game warm-ups — the Indianapolis Colts’ rookie quarterback saw his role altered from inactive/emergency QB to Daniel Jones’ backup. “I’m thinking, [...]

items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — There are times things get a little more complicated — and difficult — than expected. Like when the Indianapolis Colts lost Anthony Richardson Sr. in pre-game warm-ups Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium. The backup quarterback fractured an orbital bone in an eye when he was working with a resistance band. Like when the [...]

items.summary: The Colts were without Charvarius Ward Sr. (concussion) and Kenny Moore II (Achilles) in Sunday's 31-27 win over the Cardinals.

items.title: Daniel Jones' preparation shines against shape-shifting Cardinals defense as Colts' offense keeps rolling
items.summary: The Arizona Cardinals rolled into downtown Indianapolis for Week 6 having not allowed more than 23 points in a game this season; the Colts needed all 31 points they scored on Sunday to improve to 5-1.

items.title: Colts capitalize on 3 red zone stops to rally in win over Cardinals
items.summary: It seemed like neither team could get a stop in the second half, but the Indianapolis Colts secured their third red zone stop with a critical turnover on downs to outlast the Arizona Cardinals in Sunday’s thrilling 31-27 victory inside Lucas Oil Stadium.  Colts quarterback Daniel Jones has guided the surging city to a 5-1 […]

items.title: Behind ground game, Colts grind out tough home win, 31-27, against Cardinals
items.summary: Even with the Arizona Cardinals starting backup quarterback Jacoby Brissett in this one, the game would come down to the final minutes—as the Indianapolis Colts eked out a tough 31-27 home win. The Colts offense once again heavily rode the hot hand of Jonathan Taylor and the ground game. Taylor remains a legitimate MVP and […]

items.title: Anthony Richardson eye injury will keep Colts QB out for a while
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts announced before Sunday’s game that quarterback Anthony Richardson was injured during pregame warmups and would not play. After the game, we found out he wasn’t just inactive, he spent the afternoon at the hospital. Richardson fractured his orbital bone during pregame after he had an issue with a rubber leg band. You […]

items.title: Colts rally to beat Cardinals, 31-27, to improve to 5-1
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Indianapolis Colts rallied from a fourth-quarter deficit to beat the Arizona Cardinals, 31-27, at Lucas Oil Stadium on Sunday afternoon to improve to 5-1. The offense scored two touchdowns in the fourth quarter, then the defense shut the door on the visitors as they drove for the go-ahead score in the final [...]

items.title: Raiders’ Tristin McCollum fined for hit that ended kicker Spencer Shrader’s season
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The play that cost Spencer Shrader the rest of the season cost Tristin McCollum $5,722. That was the fine levied against the Las Vegas Raiders safety by the NFL on Saturday. McCollum dove into the right leg of Shrader on a second-quarter PAT in the Indianapolis Colts’ 40-6 win over the Raiders last [...]

items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Normalcy has returned for Alec Pierce. And the Indianapolis Colts’ offense. The Colts signed him as an undrafted rookie out of [...]

items.title: Kicker Michael Badgley brings familiarity and competitiveness in return to Colts: 'He'll fit right in'
items.summary: By kicking in 12 games for the Colts in 2021, Badgley already has well-established relationships with long snapper Luke Rhodes and punter Rigoberto Sanchez that will make his integration into the team “a lot smoother.”

The team has signed Michael Badgley, whose seven-year career includes spending the 2021 season in Indy, according to a source with knowledge of the situation. That season, Badgley initially was signed to the practice squad after Rodrigo Blankenship [...]
